cellularAutomata.cellState.model
Class RealValuedState

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.cellState.model.CellState
      cellularAutomata.cellState.model.RealValuedState

public class RealValuedState
extends CellState

A cell state for a cellular automaton with complex numbers as states.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

RealValuedState

public RealValuedState(double state,
                       double emptyState,
                       double fullState)
Sets a double value as the initial state with a default cell state view.

Parameters:
state - Any double value to be used as the state.
emptyState - The state corresponding to a "blank", like 0.0. The default view draws a color scaled between the emptyState and fullState.
fullState - The state corresponding to a filled cell, like 1.0. The default view draws a color scaled between the emptyState and fullState.

clone

public CellState clone()
Creates a clone of this cellState; this method must return a different instance of the cell state, but with all the same values.

The intent is that, for any CellState x, the expression: x.clone() != x will be true, and that the expression: x.clone().getClass() == x.getClass() will be true. Also: x.clone().equals(x) will be true.

(Note this method is used in places where we need a copy of the cell's state but that the same instance would cause unpredictable or incorrect behavior.)

Specified by:
clone in class CellState
Returns:
A unique copy of the cell's state (must not return "this" object).

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.Object state)
Sets a value for this cell state. Overrides the parent class implementation so that we can save the state locally and convert to an array.

Overrides:
setValue in class CellState
Parameters:
